sect2.para: The Linux-Libc-Headers package contains the sanitized kernel headers.

sect2.title: Installation of Linux-Libc-Headers
sect2.para: For years it has been common practice to use raw kernel headers (straight from a kernel tarball) in /usr/include, but over the last few years, the kernel developers have taken a strong stance that this should not be done. This gave birth to the Linux-Libc-Headers Project, which was designed to maintain an API stable version of the Linux headers.

screen.userinput: install -dv /usr/include/{asm,linux,mtd,scsi} cp -arv include/asm-i386/* /usr/include/asm cp -arv include/linux /usr/include/linux cp -arv include/mtd /usr/include/mtd cp -arv include/scsi /usr/include/scsi

sect2.para: Ensure that all the headers are owned by root:
Make sure the users can read the headers:

screen.userinput: find /usr/include/{asm,linux,mtd,scsi} -type d -exec chmod 755 {} \; find /usr/include/{asm,linux,mtd,scsi} -type f -exec chmod 644 {} \;
